page.title: 09Market Garden
page.content: Church's or Mayfield nursery covers 12 acres. One and a half acres are glasshouses growing tomatoes, lettuce, marrows, radish; outside, wheat is grown on 8 acres, with some runner beans. Woodend Farm next door has recently taken over the nursery. Its 3 workers also work on the nursery. Produce is sold at the farm shop and to local shops. The nursery was started in 1930 by the Belling Electrical Company, to experiment with heating glass-houses by electricity. It became Church's in 1960, when it was run by a specialist electrical engineer until 1980.
